page.title: 12LOCAL HISTORY CUCKFIELD
page.content: The road which carried the London to Brighton stagecoach ran through the territory on the B 2114. This was used until the A 23 was constucted in 1813. A service was started in 1766 and it took all day to travel in a leisurely fashion from London to Brighton. Tollgates in the area were thrown open in 1866. Pilstye Farm dates originally from about 1647 with a third story added in the 19th century, but it appears that the suffix " Stye" here and others in the area originate from the Scandinavian god TIW. Spicers Farm is a 15th century timber framed building, the roof partly Horsham slabs and partly clay tiles. Nearby is the White House originally late 16th century, but so enlarged and restored it is now more modern than old.
